rdf:Description.rdfs:label: taken at depth
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: At which depth in the ProxyArchive is the Variable measured or inferred?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Provides depth information. Can link to the depth Variable in the DataTable

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: proxy sensor model
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: Which ProxySensorModel is used in the ProxySystemModel?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Links ProxySystemModel to ProxySensorModel

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: publication year
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Part of standard metadata for Publications
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What year was the Publication issued?

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Calibration model
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Metadata about how the variable was calibrated to reflect an environmental variable
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Make the model behind the calibration explicit

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: calibration references
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: In what Reference(s) is the Calibration described/justified?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Relationship needed to link to a Publication desribing the calibration being applied to the dataset

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Proxy archive model
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A Model of how the ProxySensor either creates or emplaces the signal into the ProxyArchive. Sensu Evans et al. (2013)
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: We adopted the Evans et al. (2013) framework since this is the only published definition of what is most commonly referred to as ""proxy"" in the paleoclimate community"

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: proxy sensor type
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: Which ProxySensor underlies this ProxySystem?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Links ProxySensor to ProxyArchive

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Uncertainty model
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A Model quantifiying the Uncertainty
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Allows description of how uncertainty was calculated

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: measured on
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: On which PhysicalSample was the MeasuredVariable measured?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Links the MeasuredVariable to the ProxyArchive. Refers to the specific archive (i.e. the specific coral head, lake sediment...) and a specific Variable since ProxyArchive provides a link to the ProxySensor. In some instances, two MeasuredVariables on the same PhysicalSample may have different ProxyArchive page. This would be the case for measurements on various species of foraminifera in a MarineSediment

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: funded by
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What was the Funding source for the Dataset?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Links a dataset to its source of funding

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Distribution table
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: DataTable containing the probability distribution of a single value of a Variable. Output of a Model
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Added to allow outputs from Bayesian model (especially Bchron) to be saved as part of a dataset. Required to encode irregular probability distributions

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Inferred variable
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A Variable that is inferred from one or more MeasuredVariable (s)
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: See InferredVariable Ontology for concept description.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: author
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: Who wrote (i.e., created) the resource, such as a Publication?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Give credit to the original author of the resource

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Person
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An individual who has participated directly or indirectly in the authoring of any resources on the LinkedEarth wiki
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: The researcher, author on a publication.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has uncertainty
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What is the Uncertainty associated with the Variable, Model, or Instrument?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Links to the Uncertainty class

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Paleo proxy system
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Climate observations prior to the instrumental era are necessarily indirect. These observations are made on climate proxies in various geological (e.g. lake or marine sediments, living or fossil coral reefs, cave deposits), glaciological (ice cores or snow pits) or biological (trees) archives. Many types of measurements can be made on each archives, each sensing a different aspect of the environment (sometimes, several aspects at once). A paleoclimate dataset is a set of observations made on an archive.
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Gives a formal definition of climate proxy following the Evans et al. (2013) framework. Subclass of ProxySystem, pertaining to climate information

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: principal investigator
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: Who was the lead on the source of Funding for the Dataset?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Links the source of Funding to the PI (a Person)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Proxy system
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment:
Climate observations prior to the instrumental era are necessarily indirect. These observations are made on climate proxies in various geological (e.g. lake or marine sediments, living or fossil coral reefs, cave deposits), glaciological (ice cores or snow pits) or biological (trees) archives. Many types of data can often be collected from each archives, each sensing a different aspect of the environment (sometimes, several aspects at once). A paleoclimate dataset is almost always a time series of observations made on an archive.

Evans et al. (2013) [1] define a proxy system as comprised of three components (Fig 1).:

  • The sensor comprises physical, chemical, and/or biological components that react to environmental conditions. Sensors often respond to more than one environmental variable, and may have complex responses to the environment they sense, including thresholds (record only part of the range of environmental conditions), seasonal biases (record environmental conditions over a few months of the year), and/or nonlinear responses. For instance, foraminifera are an often used sensor for oceanic conditions. Multiple observations can be made on this sensor, recording different environmental variables. Similarly, picking foraminifera of a given species to conduct the measurements is part of the observation process, though it does affect the sensor definition : the habitat of these forams determines with environmental variable (e.g. surface, sub-surface, or thermocline temperature) they are most sensitive to.
  • The archive is the medium in which the response of a sensor to environmental forcing is recorded. Marine sediments are a type of archive, on which many sensors and observations may be recorded (e.g. Foraminifera Mg/Ca, δ18O, TEX86)
  • Observations are made on archives and are generally referred to as "proxies". The term "proxy" used ubiquitously, and often ambiguously, throughout the paleoclimate literature, is most commonly equivalent to "sensor + observation". "Observation" is the more explicit, and thus, preferred term, however "proxy" can be treated as a synonym of "observation". For instance, Foraminifera Mg/Ca is often used to investigate past changes in sea-surface temperature but depends also on sea-surface salinity and deep-ocean carbonate saturation [2]. Furthermore, its temperature and salinity dependence is exponential [3] [4] [5] while its response to carbonate saturation is thresholded [6].

These three major components may be individually modeled, and linked together within a Proxy System Model [1] [7]. Some sensors are common to multiple archives (e.g. δ18O), and all archives support more than one possible sensor.

References

  1. ↑ Jump up to: 1.0 1.1 1.2 Evans, M. N., Tolwinski-Ward, S. E., Thompson, D. M., & Anchukaitis, K. J. (2013). Applications of proxy system modeling in high resolution paleoclimatology. Quaternary Science Reviews, 76, 16-28. doi:10.1016/j.quascirev.2013.05.024
  2. Jump up ↑ Khider, D., Huerta, G., Jackson, C., Stott, L. D., & Emile-Geay, J. (2015). A Bayesian, multivariate calibration for Globigerinoides ruber Mg/Ca. Geochemistry Geophysics Geosystems, 16(9), 2916-2932. doi:10.1002/2015GC005844
  3. Jump up ↑ Anand, P., Elderfield, H., & Conte, M. H. (2003). Calibration of Mg/Ca thermometry in planktonic foraminifera from a sediment trap time series. Paleoceanography, 18(2), 1050. doi:10.1029/2002PA000846
  4. Jump up ↑ Lea, D. W., Mashiotta, T. A., & Spero, H. J. (1999). Controls on magnesium and strontium uptake in planktonic foraminifera determined by live culturing. Geochimica et cosmochimica acta, 63(16), 2369-2379.
  5. Jump up ↑ Kisakürek, B., Eisenhauer, A., Böhm, F., Garbe-Schönberg, D., & Erez, J. (2008). Controls on shell Mg/Ca and Sr/Ca in cultured planktonic foraminiferan, Globigeriniodes ruber (white). Earth and Planetary Science Letters, 273, 260-269. doi:10.1016/j.epsl.2008.06.026
  6. Jump up ↑ Regenberg, M., Regenberg, A., Garbe-Schonberg, D., & Lea, D. W. (2014). Global dissolution effects on planktonic foraminiferal Mg/Ca ratios controlled by the calcite-saturation state of bottom waters. Paleoceanography, 29, 127-142. doi:10.1002/2013PA002492
  7. Jump up ↑ Dee, S., Emile-Geay, J., Evans, M. N., Allam, A., Steig, E. J., & Thompson, D. M. (2015). PRYSM: An open-source framework for PRoxy System Modeling, with applications to oxygen-isotope systems. Journal of Advances in Modeling Earth Systems, 7, 1220-1247. doi:10.1002/2015MS000447
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: We adopted the Evans et al. (2013) framework since this is the only published definition of what is most commonly referred to as "proxy" in the paleoclimate community

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Measurement table
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: DataTable that contains the Variables (both measured and inferred)
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Subclass of DataTable. Allows InferredVariables (despite the name) for practical purposes

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Data
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An aggregation of DataTables and Models with their supporting paleoenvironmental and/or chronological information
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Needed to describe the paleoenvironmental and/or chronological data comprising the dataset as opposed to the Publication, Funding and Location information

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: proxy observation type
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What type of ProxyObservation does the MeasuredVariable or Proxy System belong to? For example, the measured value of 5.63 mmol/mol is of type Mg/Ca, or the proxy observation of the current prpoxy system is Mg/Ca
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: The need to link a measured variable or a proxy system to the proxy observation type being measured.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: sensor genus
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What is the Genus of the Organic ProxySensor?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Scientific Name of the organic ProxySensor

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: equation
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What is the mathematical formulation of the Model?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Allows to provide the equation as part of the metadata

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Proxy observation
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The type of MeasuredVariables measured on the ProxyArchive, whether chemical (e.g. Mg/Ca, D18O, Sr/Ca), physical (e.g. density, layer thickness), or biological (e.g. Species abundance)
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale:
See ProxyObservation ontology for details about the concept.
We adopted the Evans et al. (2013) framework since this is the only published definition of what is most commonly referred to as ""proxy"" in the paleoclimate community

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: found in measurement table
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: In which MeasurementTable are the Variables found?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Subproperty of foundinTable to link the Data to the Variables

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has code
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What SoftwareCode was used to generate the Model output?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Links a Model to its SoftwareCode.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Inorganic proxy sensor
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: An inorganic substrate sensing enviromental changes. Examples: karst, snow, watershed, ice sheet, rock, etc.
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Encode the Genus and Species metadata

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: standard
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: Reference material against which the MeasuredVariable is reported?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Crucial for isotopic measurements (for instance, d18O measurements (VSMOW vs VPDB))

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: journal
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What is the name of the journal in which the resource can be found?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Part of standard metadata for Publications

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Funding
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Source of monetary support underlying the collection/creation/analysis/curation of the Dataset
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Allows to associate a grant number following U.S. federal regulation

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: model references
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: In which Publication is the model described/applied?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Links a Model to its Publication. Note: calibrationReferences and modelReferences in the Calibration may not need to be the same. For instance, the calibration data and one mathematical formulation can be provided in one Publication (answering the calibrationReferences) but a different mathematical Model may be applied in another Publication (answering the modelReferences)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: method
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: How is the information obtained from the resource?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Allows to describe methods.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: uncertainty level
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment:
Answers the question: What parameter of the error distribution is the Uncertainty value referring to?
Examples include 1-sigma, 2-sigma, 95% confidence bounds
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Allows to properly make use of the reported Uncertainty values

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: orcid number
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What is the persistent digital identifier of the Person?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: LinkedEarth uses ORCID number for membership

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Proxy system model
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: In the Evans et al. (2013) framework, this is the combination of sensor, archive and observation models . "A generalized proxy system model encapuslates a simplified representation of prior physical, chemical, biological, and/or geological understanding of the ways in which environmental variation ultimately results in the observations used to retrieve paleoclimatic information."
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: We adopted the Evans et al. (2013) framework since this is the only published definition of what is most commonly referred to as "proxy" in the paleoclimate community

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: ensemble table generated by model
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: In which EnsembleTable is the Model output found?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: "Subproperty of foundinTable to link the Model to its outputs"

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has max value
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What is the maximum value of the Variable?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: property relevant to facilitate queries, as in most cases the contents of a csv file are not directly represented

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Interpretation
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A suite of metadata that describes which phenomena drove variability in this Variable (e.g. environmental drivers).
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Used to describe the interpretation of the Variable. For instance, radiocarbon is interpreted to represent age

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Location
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The geographic data and metadata for the dataset
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Gives information about where the ProxyArchive comes from.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: contributor
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: Who contributed the resource? A contributor may be the same as the authors of the resource or different. For instance, in the case of a legacy dataset, a Linked Earth member may contribute a previously-published dataset that he/she may not have authored
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Allows distinction between contributor to a resource and the author

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has rank
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What is the importance of the Interpretation?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Allows to rank the environmental variable controlling the interpretation. For instance, the d18O of coral aragonite responds to both temperature and the d18O of seawater (closely linked to salinity). Depending on the locale and/or timescale, one variable may dominate over the other.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: pages
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: In what pages of the Publication can the reference to the resource be found?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Part of standard metadata for Publications

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: proxy observation model
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: Which ProxyObservationModel is used in the ProxySystemModel?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Links ProxySystemModel to ProxyObservationModel

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: calibrated via
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What calibration process was used to relate the InferredVariable to the MeasuredVariable?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Provides calibration information, especially useful for legacy datasets where the raw measurements may not be available and for comparison of datasets.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has ISSN
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What is the International Standard Serial Number of the Publication?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: 8-digit code used to identify publications

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The class ssn:Observation provides the structure to represent a single observation. An observation is a situation that describes an observed feature, an observed property, a sensor and method of sensing used and a value observed for the property: that is, an observation describes a single value attributed to a single property by a particular sensor. Observations of multiple features or multiple properties of the one feature should be represented as either compound properties, features and values or as multiple observations, grouped in some appropriate structure.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Instrument
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A tool used to produce MeasuredVariables
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Needed to categorize types of instruments used for taking the different measurements. See Instrument Ontology for concept description.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has DOI
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What is the digital object identifier associated with the resource?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Allows to link to a resource using a digital object identifier

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has units
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: In what unit of measure is (are) the Variable(s) expressed?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Links the units and the values of the Variable

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has integration time
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What is the integration time needed for a ProxySensor to imprint environmental information on the ProxyArchive? Both are included as part of a ProxySystem
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Property added to link the proxySystem to the IntegrationTime class

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Data table
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A set of Variables organized in columns
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Connects to the csv file where the data values are stored

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: PaleoData table
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: DataTable containing PaleoData Variables
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Subdivision between chronological and paleoenvironmental information reflects the fact that Datasets are fundamentally characterized by two distinct components

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: published in
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: In which Publication was the Dataset or Compilation issued?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Links the resource to its Publication

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Proxy observation model
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The Model of how ProxyObservations are made on the archive. Sensu Evans et al. (2013)
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: We adopted the Evans et al. (2013) framework since this is the only published definition of what is most commonly referred to as ""proxy"" in the paleoclimate community

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: proxy archive model
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: Which ProxyArchiveModel is used in the ProxySystemModel?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Links ProxySystemModel to ProxyArchiveModel

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has mean value
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What is the mean value of the Variable?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: property relevant to facilitate queries, as in most cases the contents of a csv file are not directly represented

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Peer reviewed publication
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A Publication that has undergone a formal peer-review process
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Subclass of Publication.Allows to clearly mark datasets generated as part of a peer-reviewed publication.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Physical sample
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The actual sample on which the measurements are made. For instance, the lake core analyzed in the lab is the physical sample.
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Used to differentiate between the concept of a ProxyArchive and its physical (real) manifestation

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: compilation citation
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: How should someone cite the compilation?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Data property needed to specify how to cite compilations, in order to provide appropriate credit to all contributors

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Software code
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A script that describes the model, in any programming language (e.g., Excel, Matlab, Python, R)
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Added to allow for a link towards the code if on a public repository like GitHub

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Summary table
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A DataTable that contains summary information for the Variable and is output from a Model.
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Allows to represent a summary of basic statistics such as median, mean, standard deviation, and various quantiles from the output of the Model

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: volume
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: In which volume of the Publication does the reference to the Datatset appear?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Part of standard metadata for Publications

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: notes
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What additional information would you give about the Variable or DataTable ?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Allows to add notes to specific cells in the DataTable

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: inferred from
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: From which MeasuredVariable(s) is (are) the InferredVariable inferred from?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Provides a link between the Measured and Inferred Variables. For instance, SST is inferred from Mg/Ca measurements

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: funding country
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: Which nation funded the Dataset?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Provides information about the country the agency is from

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Non peer reviewed publication
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A publication that has not undergone a formal review process; for instance, a Dataset attached to a dissertation.
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Subclass of Publication.Allows to clearly mark datasets not generated as part of a peer-reviewed publication.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: modeled by
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What is the Model for the Data, Compilation or ProxySystem under consideration?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Links Data, Compilation or ProxySystem to Model

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: chron modeled by
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What is the ChronModel for the ChronData or ProxySystem under consideration?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Subproperty of modeledBy. The subdivision between chronological and paleoenvironmental information reflects the fact that Datasets are fundamentally characterized by two distinct components

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Chron data table
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: DataTable containing Variables pertaining to chronological information
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Subdivision between chronological and paleoenvironmental information reflects the fact that Datasets are fundamentally characterized by two distinct components

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: interpreted as
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What is the Variable's Interpretation?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Links the Variable to its Interpretation

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: distribution table generated by Model
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: In which DistributionTable is the Model output found?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: "Subproperty of foundinTable to Link the Model to its outputs"

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has execution command
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What is the command to run the script or the code?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Allows to store the execution command of a script

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Paleo model
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Model used to derive an environmental axis from the PaleoDataModel
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Subdivision between chronological and paleoenvironmental information reflects the fact that Datasets are fundamentally characterized by two distinct components

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: dataset version
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment:
Answers the question: What is the version of the Dataset?
It should follow the x.y.z notation where x refers to changes in metadata and data following a publication (for instance, the creation of a new age model using a different code), y refers to changes to the data following a publication (for instance, adding data further back in time without changing the model underlying the interpretation), and z refers to changes not associated with a publication (for instance, typos).
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Allows to update a dataset if Data/Models are added and keep track of the various versions

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has ISBN
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What is the international book number of the Publication?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Link to the ISBN: Identifier used commonly to refer to publications

rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The LiPD Ontology aims to provide a common vocabulary for annotating paleoclimatology data
rdf:Description.dcterms:description: The LiPD Ontology aims to provide a common vocabulary for annotating paleoclimatology data
rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The LiPD Ontology

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: paleo modeled by
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What is the PaleoModel for the PaleoData or ProxySytem under consideration?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Subclass of modeledBy, pertaining to paleoenvironmental information

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: is local
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: Does the Interpretation describe local variability, or far-field variability that may not reflect local conditions?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Added to allow data analysis. Is the interpretation relevant to these coordinates? Does putting a colored dot on the map here make sense?

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: includes variable
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: Which Variables are included in the DataTable?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Links DataTable to Variable

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: issue
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: In what issue of the journal can the resource be found?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Part of standard metadata for Publications

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: funding agency
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: Which entity was the Dataset fundedBy?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Provides information about the Agency funding the study

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has IGSN
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: IGSN identifier associated to a physical sample
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Needed to properly described physical samples

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: interpretation references
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: In which Publication(s) is the Interpretation substantiated?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Links an interpretation to a reference citation (can be the same as the calibrationReferences for a Dataset)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Publication
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A document that serves as reference for a Dataset or its components
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Can be used to credit the contributor of the dataset as well as linking toward the conclusions of the study and relevant methods

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: generated by model
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: which model was used to generated this data table?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Needed to link the model to the data tables it generates

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: description
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What additional details would you give about the resource?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: This property may be used to provide further details on instrument descriptions, uncertainty description,etc.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: dataset license
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: License associated to a dataset
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Property needed to let other scientists know about the usage and attribution terms of the uploaded dataset

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: dataset citation
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Sentence indicating how a dataset should be cited
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: The need for providing appropriate credit to the datasets

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Variable
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Quantities that may change from value to value. They are usually represented as column of values in a data table
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Basic definition of the values in the columns of the csv file

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Model
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A mathematical construct that is at least partially isomorphic to the target system, and is used to derive information about the structure and/or dynamics of the target system
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Allows to describe models whose outputs are stored in the Dataset. One example of is Bchron for age modeling

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Uncertainty
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A state of incomplete knowledge that results from a lack of information or from different modeling choices. Uncertainty may come from many sources, from imprecision in the data to ambigously defined concepts or terminology. Uncertainty can be represented by quantitative measures (e.g., probability density function) or by qualitative statements (e.g., reflecting the judgement of a team of experts). Sensu IPCC AR5
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: To allow to describe the uncertainty on a Variable or a Model, would it be a single number (e.g., the uncertainty on the measurements are 0.1 per mil, one sigma confidence level, or reportedIn an EnsembleTable and/or SummaryTable)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Chron proxy system
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The combination of ProxyArchive, ProxySensor, and ProxyObservations pertaining to chronological information. For instance, measurements of radiocarbon on foraminiferal shells would have a ChronProxySystem consisting of ProxyArchive: marine sediment, ProxySensor: Foraminifera, ProxyObservations: Radiocarbon. (ref: Evans et al. [2013])
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale:
Subdivision between chronological and paleoenvironmental information reflects the fact that Datasets are fundamentally characterized by two distinct components.
Agreed that the ProxySystem concept applies to both Chron and PaleoData

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: book
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: In which book was the resource published?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Separate between journal and book publication

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: sensor species
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What is the species of the Organic ProxySensor?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Scientific Name of the organic ProxySensor

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Proxy archive
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: According to the Evans et al. (2013), the medium in which the response of a ProxySensor to environmental forcing is recorded. Example of archives include: marine sediments, corals, wood, lake sediments, speleothems, glacier ice
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale:
"See ProxyArchive ontology for details about the concept.
We adopted the Evans et al. (2013) framework since this is the only published definition of what is most commonly referred to as ""proxy"" in the paleoclimate community"

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Paleo data
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The Data pertaining to past environmental variability
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Subdivision between chronological and paleoenvironmental information reflects the fact that Datasets are fundamentally characterized by two distinct components

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: scope
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: how would you classify the Interpretation? Examples include Isotope, Climate…
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Allows to separate the various types of interpretation

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has variable ID
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What is the unique identifier for the Variable?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale:
LiPD assigns a unique identifier (TSid) to each table column described in a LiPD file.
Allows to assign a unique identifier to each series, facilitating data citation and recognition
This allows someone to change every piece of metadata about column or dataset, including its names (both dataset and variable) and still get back to the right spot. It’s fundamental to working with LiPD data.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has link
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What is the universal resource locator to a resource?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Allows to point to the original source of a resource

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Measured variable
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Variables that are measured by an Instrument. MeasuredVariables are ssn: Observations. They represent the values of a certain type of ProxyObservations
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Subclass of Variables. Allows to make the disctinction between raw measurements (e.g., tree ring width, oxygen isotopes, trace elements) and the variables being reconstructed (e.g., moisture, temperature)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Integration time
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The time it takes for the ProxySensor to imprint environmental information on the ProxyArchive. It may be further qualified with time periods and units
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Soilwater mixing above speleothems: Although the sample might only represent 5 years of calcification, it can record 30 years of water mixing.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Proxy sensor model
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A Model of the ProxySensor. Sensu Evans et al. (2013)
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: One component of the ProxySystemModel

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has execution environment
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: In which environment is the script meant to be run in?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Provides information about the operating system version in which the software code was exceuted?

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: dataset date
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Separate dataset date from the publication year. An example is LR04 (datsetdate in 2004) but published in 2005
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: At what date was the Dataset created?

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Organic proxy sensor
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Biologically-mediated ProxySensor. Examples include: foraminifera, trees, mollusks, polyps
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Subclass of ProxySensor. Makes the distinction between organic and inorganic. See the ProxySensor ontology for concepts

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Ensemble table
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: DataTable constaining many possible series of how the Variable is modeled. Output of a Model
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Added to allow outputs from Bayesian model to be saved as part of a dataset

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: collected from
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: Where (in the world) was the data in the Dataset collected? Refers to the location of the ProxyArchive
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Describe the geographical coordinates for the provenance of the ProxyArchive where the dataset was collected from

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has column number
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: In which column of the csv file can the Variable be found?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Links the Variable metadata to the values stored in the csv file

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: compilation version
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What is the version of the Compilation?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Needed to state the version associated to a compilation, which may not be the same as the datasets it contains

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: includes chron data
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: Which ChronData are included in the Dataset?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Subproperty of includesData. The subdivision between chronological and paleoenvironmental information reflects the fact that Datasets are fundamentally characterized by two distinct components

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: measured by
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: Which Instrument was used to produce the MeasuredVariable?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Links the MeasuredVariable to the Instrument responsible for its creation

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: grant number
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What is the unique identifier associated with the Funding for the Dataset?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Provides information about the grant number

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: seasonality
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: To which part of the year is the Interpretation or ProxySensor restricted to? Acceptable answers may be "MJJA", "growing season",or [5,6,7,8]
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Seasonality is critical to properly related measuredVariable and innferredVariable, as the former only senses part of the range of the latter.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has resolution
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What is the Resolution of the Variable?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Needed to link a Variable to Resolution

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: compilation date
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: At what date was the Compilation created?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Separate compilation date from the publication year. An example is LR04 (datsetdate in 2004) but published in 2005

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: reported in
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: In which EnsembleTable, DistributionTable, and/or SummaryTable is the Uncertainty reported?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Links the uncertainty to the model output

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has median value
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What is the median value of the Variable?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: property relevant to facilitate queries, as in most cases the contents of a csv file are not directly represented

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: includes paleo data
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: Which PaleoData are included in the Dataset?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Subproperty of includesData. The subdivision between chronological and paleoenvironmental information reflects the fact that Datasets are fundamentally characterized by two distinct components

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Chron model
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Model used to derive a time (or age) axis from the ChronDataModel
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Subdivision between chronological and paleoenvironmental information reflects the fact that Datasets are fundamentally characterized by two distinct components

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Chron data
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The data, metadata, and Model that describe the set of Variables used to relate depth/position to time (chronological information)
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Subdivision between chronological and paleoenvironmental information reflects the fact that Datasets are fundamentally characterized by two distinct components

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Proxy sensor
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: The sensor comprises physical, chemical, and/or biological components that react to environmental conditions. Sensors often respond to more than one environmental variable, and may have complex responses to the environment they sense, including thresholds (record only part of the range of environmental conditions), seasonal biases (record environmental conditions over a few months of the year), and/or nonlinear responses (Evans et al. (2013)). Signals recorded by the ProxySensor are imprinted onto the ProxyArchive.
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale:
See ProxySensor ontology for details about the concept.
We adopted the Evans et al. (2013) framework since this is the only published definition of what is most commonly referred to as ""proxy"" in the paleoclimate community

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: housed at
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: In which laboratory/repository is the Instrument/PhysicalSample located?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Link to a particular laboratory. Provides circumstantial information about the measurement technique and how it was applied. Allows to give some information about the actual location of the sample

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Dataset
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A structured collection of related information, including -but not limited to -measured and/or modelled geograhical, chronological, and environmental data
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Fundamental unit at which we think about paleoclimate data. Also tends to correspond to the scope of the study

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Resolution
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Refers to the time difference between two adjacent values of a Variable.
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Class added to describe the annual resolution of the archives

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has proxy system
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What is the ProxySystem associated with this MeasuredVariable?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Links the MeasuredVariable to its ProxySystem. For instance, Mg/Ca measurements on foraminiferal shells have ProxySystem: MarineSediment.Foraminifera.Mg/Ca

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: summary table generated by model
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: In which SummaryTable can the statistics on the Model Output be found?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Subproperty of foundinTable to link the Model to its outputs

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: detail
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the "of what" question for an Interpretation. For intance, sea surface in sea surface temperature.

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: programmed in
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: In which language was the software code written in?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Provides the user with information about the software

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: proxy archive type
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: Which ProxyArchive underlies this ProxySystem?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Links ProxySystem to ProxyArchive

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: Compilation
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: A curated aggregation of datasets
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Encodes what Data/Metadata gathering effort/scientific project led to the curation of the Datasets. Examples: PAGES2k, Iso2k, LR04, OC3, MARGO

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: relevant quote
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: Which part of the publication describes the Calibration or Interpretation?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Often it's useful to put a quote from the paper that describes the interpretation

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has missing value
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: How are the missing values of the Variable identified in the DataTable?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Useful for coding around the missing values

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: email
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What is the email address of the Person?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Allow to store contact information

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: inferred variable type
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What type of InferredVariable does the InferredVariable belongs to?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Links the InferredVariable values to their type. For instance, the value of 29.1 degC is of type SST. This is important to normalize the variations in VariableNames (e.g. SST, sst, sea-surface temp)

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: part of compilation
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answer the question: Which compilation does a dataset belong to?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Links the dataset to the compilation

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has value
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What are the numerical values of the Variable, Uncertainty, and Model outputs?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Useful if there is only a single value rather than a vector of numbers. Often the case for analytical uncertainty or uncertainty reported as a RMSE

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has file name
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What is the name of the csv file in which the Variable values are stored?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Links a DataTable with its appropriate csv file

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: includes data
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: Which Data are included in the Dataset?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Links Dataset to Data

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: found in table
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: In which DataTable can the information/data be found?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Allows to link the data to the csv table and the models to its output

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: name
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: How is the resource called?

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: has min value
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What is the minimum value of the Variable?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: property relevant to facilitate queries, as in most cases the contents of a csv file are not directly represented

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: interpretation direction
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: Is the InferredVariable value increasing or decreasing as the value of the MeasuredVariable is increasing?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Answer is only positive or negative. Useful metadata when the calibration equation is not readily available. Also applies to InferredVariable to faciliate the search in database

rdf:Description.rdfs:label: title
rdf:Description.rdfs:comment: Answers the question: What is the title of the Publication?
rdf:Description.vaem:rationale: Part of standard metadata for Publications
